title: Tapi Carpets reports profit rise driven by organic growth - Retail Gazette
summary:
- Tapi Carpets reported a significant increase in operating profit, rising from £8.1 million in 2023 to £15.9 million in 2024, attributed to organic growth and strategic investments in customer experience.
- Sales surged by 33% to £227 million, with continued like-for-like revenue growth despite challenges in big-ticket consumer spending.
- The company expanded its footprint by opening three new stores and launching concessions in 19 John Lewis department stores, while also completing 42 conversions from the acquired Carpetright brand.
- CEO Jeevan Karir emphasized the importance of ongoing investment in store openings and product offerings to maintain competitive advantage and profitability.
- Retail executives should note the successful integration of acquisitions and the focus on enhancing customer experience as key strategies for driving growth in a challenging market.
